content:
Do you mean you want to change ESR channel (version 128.10.1esr) to Release channel (version 138.0.2)? If the answer is yes, the following links might be helpful: 1. Thunderbird Release Channel Update https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/03/thunderbird-release-channel-update/ 2. Thunderbird Release https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-release

- - -

Note:

(a) About backup: Quotation from the above link:

we strongly recommend that you backup the Thunderbird profile, as you should always do before making major changes.

(b) If you are using add-ons, please make sure those add-ons are compatible with 138.0.2 before upgrading Thunderbird. Moreover, please see point 3 in the following link: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1513040#answer-1735078
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

"application/octet-stream":{"action":2,"handlers":[{"name":"gnome-text-editor","path":"/run/user/1019214002/doc/3d5685d4/gnome-text-editor"},{"name":"gedit","path":"/run/user/1019214002/doc/1ab6d2b0/gedit"}],"ask":true}

So far so good -- I can select either editor. The funny thing, though, is that I can tell it to open the file, but no editor-window pops up. What else do I need to do? content:
Potrebbe trattarsi del problema discusso qui: https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79602.0 Però non so se sia il tuo caso, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: The error message is coming from email provider; thunderbird is only sharing that with you. If the password works when logging on online, then it may be that the provider uses app passwords or that the server settings may be incorrect. Sharing the full text of the error message sometimes help, as does a screenshot of appropriate server settings, whether input or output.
creator: davidsk

content: For that to happen, all devices must be using IMAP settings. It may be that one or more persons have device set for POP instead. If that is true, the POP account cannot be switched to IMAP, but must create a new account setting.

content: Thank you David, however that is not the issue. We all have our devices set for IMAP.
creator: tim296

content: In that case, I suggest you do some testing to validate where the problem is happening. Such as send a message from your phone and see if the PC sees it. Then see if the other phones see it. Then, rotate the task to another phone and have that person send a message and identify which of the others see it. After testing them all, you should see where the problem is happening. Let me know.
creator: davidsk

content: Select the address book right click on the highlighted address book and select 'Export' OR click on the 3 dot icon that appears when you select the address book and select 'Export' Choose where to save it eg: flashdrive SAve as type: select 'Comma Separated (UTF-8)(*.csv)' Useful for importing again or importing to another device or software. You can also open a 'comma separated' file using eg: Excel or Open Office Calc etc Save as Type: select 'LDIF (*.ldi, *.ldif)' if you only want to import back into Thunderbird or another Thunderbird on another device.

content: Customizations are always unsupported, as CSS may change at any time. My guess, and it's only a guess, is that the version you last used with this CSS was probably release 91 or older, as CSS had considerable change with 102. There is the possibility that someone will offer the CSS you want, but that I cannot predict.

However if you wish to make suggestions of offer feedback, please use the forum provided for the purpose which is monitored by the development community. I last encountered a developer in this forum about a decade ago. The more paid staff Mzla has the less they drop into support forums.

There is a link on the Thunderbird help menu for feedback and ideas that links here https://connect.mozilla.org/
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Correct answer _________________________________ Thanks to Perplexity, but not ChatGPT _________________________________ The code that goes in [your profile folder]/Chrome/userChrome.css IS: __________________________________ /* Move the message pane to the middle in vertical layout (Thunderbird 128+) */ body.layout-vertical { 

 grid-template:    "folders folderPaneSplitter message messagePaneSplitter threads" auto /    minmax(auto, var(--folderPaneSplitter-width))    min-content    minmax(auto, var(--messagePaneSplitter-width))    min-content    minmax(auto, 1fr) !important;

}
creator: zens.info

creator: MattAuSupport

content: Your suggestion centers everything, pics side by side not one after another down the center of the page.
creator: cboydg21

content:
You could insert a table just one cell width and as many rows as required for images. If you want to have text either side of image but with it's own right alignment then create eg: 3 cells width. You can set alignment of table itself as center using the 'Advanced Edit' button Attribute: align and Value: Center

Put an image in each row cell or middle cell if using 3 cell width. Set content alignment of a cell as center. Double click in the cell to get the pop up to set up cell properties. and set that cell to use alignment as center via 'Advanced Edit' button.

Now all text is normal and all images are central.
creator: Toad-Hall
